help.name: Support Group Migration
help.description: This action is an ITSM utility, designed to migrate a support group details, by making Obsolete the original one and creating a new one with the specified options. All related details (e.g. aliases and memberships etc.) of the old support group will be copied to the new support group. Moreover, this action is able to replace the old support group with the new one in incidents, problems, known errors, changes, tasks, work orders and asset relationships.
help.syntax: areasy -action supportgroupmigration -sgroupcompany CurrentSupportGroupCompany -sgrouporganisation CurrentSupportGroupOrganisation -sgroupname CurrentSupportGroupName [-sgroupid CurrentSupportGroupId] -newsgroupcompany NewSupportGroupCompany -newsgrouporganisation NewSupportGroupOrganisation -newsgroupname NewSupportGroupName [-creategroup] [-updategroup] [-allgroupdetails] | [ [-members] [-keepoldmembers] [-functionalroles] [-keepoldfunctionalroles] [-aliases] [-keepoldaiases] [-favorites] [-keepoldfavorites] [-oncalls] [-shifts] ] [-allrelatedtickets] | [ [-incidenttemplates] [-incidents [-incidentsbefore StartDate] [-incidentsafter EndDate] -openincidents]] [-problemtemplates] [-problems [-problemsbefore StartDate] [-problemsafter EndDate] [-openproblems]] [-knownerrors [-knownerrorsbefore StartDate] [-knownerrorsafter EndDate] [-openknownerrors]] [-changetemplates] [-changes [-changesbefore StartDate] [-changesafter EndDate] [-openchanges]] [-tasktemplates] [-tasks [-tasksbefore StartDate] [-tasksafter EndDate] -opentasks]] [-workordertemplates] [-workorders [-workordersbefore StartDate] [-workorderafter EndDate] -openworkorders]] [-assetrelationships] [-cmdbrelationships] [-knowledgerecords] [-approvalmappings] ]

option.description: Current support group company. In addition the action supports another alias for this option: supportgroupcompany
Current support group organisation. In addition the action supports another alias for this option: supportgrouporganisation
Current support group name. In addition the action supports some aliases for this option: sgroup, supportgroup, supportgroupname
Current support group id. In addition the action supports some aliases for this options: supportgroupid
New support group company (company part of the new support group that will be created). In addition the action supports another alias for this option: newsupportgroupcompany
New support group organisation (organisation part of the new support group that will be created). In addition the action supports another alias for this option: newsupportgrouporganisation
New support group name (group name part of the new support group that will be created). In addition the action supports some aliases for this option: sgroup, supportgroup, supportgroupname
Allows to create the new group (in case it is not found in in the system)
Allows to update the new group (in case it is already registered in the system)

Transfer all related details from old support group to the new support group. Here are considered all members, alias, functional roles, oncall records, shifts, etc. (actually this option could be used in case of you want to create a mirrored support group)

Migrates to the new support group all people accounts that are members of old support group. In case the old support group was the primary group for specific accounts the primary role will be transferred to the new support group (and for the old one it will be reset)
Specifies if during migration process the members of old support group will be kept or not
Migrates to the new support group all functional roles found to the old support group
Specifies if during migration process the functional roles related to the old support group will be kept or not
Migrates old support group aliases to the new support group
Specifies if aliases that belongs to the current support group is be kept in the system or not
Transfers old support group favorites to the new support group
Specifies if during migration the favorites setting of the old support group to be preserved
Transfers old support group on-call records to the new support group
Transfers old support group shifts to the new support group

Changes all assignment types in all type of ticket managed by ITSM suite (incidents, problems, known errors, changes and asset relationships). In case of you want to convert discrete ticket types you have use the options described below (for each ticket type)
Transfers old support group approval mappings to the new support group
Changes the assignment and all authoring support groups in incident templates
Changes the assignment and owner support groups in incident tickets
Allows you to change only incidents that are created before the specified date. This option excludes 'incidentsafter' option and vice-versa
Allows you to change only incidents that are created after the specified date. This option excludes 'incidentsbefore' option and vice-versa
Allows you to change only open incidents (all incidents that have status = Assigned, In Progress, Pending or Resolved)
Changes the assignment and all authoring support groups in problem templates
Changes the assignment and coordinator support groups in problem tickets
Allows you to change only problems that are created before the specified date. This option excludes 'problemsafter' option and vice-versa
Allows you to change only problems that are created after the specified date. This option excludes 'problemsbefore' option and vice-versa
Allows you to change only open problems (all problems that have status = Draft, Under Review, Request For Authorization, Assigned, Under Investigation, Pending or Completed)
Changes the assignment and coordinator support groups in known errors tickets
Allows you to change only known errors that are created before the specified date. This option excludes 'knownerrorssafter' option and vice-versa
Allows you to change only known errors that are created after the specified date. This option excludes 'knownerrorsbefore' option and vice-versa
Allows you to change only open known errors (all known errors that have status = Assigned, Scheduled For Correction, Assigned To Vendor, No Action Planned or Corrected)
Update the assignment and all authoring support groups in change templates
Update the assignment, coordinator and change manager support groups in change tickets
Allows you to update only changes that are created before the specified date. This option excludes 'changesafter' option and vice-versa
Allows you to update only changes that are created after the specified date. This option excludes 'changesbefore' option and vice-versa

Allows you to update only open changes (all changes that have status = Draft, Request For Authorization, Request For Change, Planning In Progress, Scheduled For Review, Scheduled For Approval, Scheduled, Implementation In Progress, Pending, Rejected or Completed)

It could take 'update' or 'append' value; the meaning of this option is related permission group id associated with a support group entity; if the new support group name and id will be updated in tickets (incidents changes, etc.) also the related permission group id has to be updated by replacing or appending the new group id

sample.code: areasy -runtime -action supportgroupmigration -members -aliases -supportgroupcompany "Calbro Services" -supportgrouporganisation "Services Performance" -supportgroupname "Development" -newsupportgroupcompany "Calbro Services" -newsupportgrouporganisation "IT Service Management" -newsupportgroupname "Development" -loglevel info
sample.description: Makes old support group offline, creates a new support group and transfers from old group to the new one the following entities: aliases, people accounts and application functional roles

sample.code: areasy -runtime -action supportgroupmigration -members -aliases -incidents -incidenttemplates -supportgroupcompany "Calbro Services" -supportgrouporganisation "Services Performance" -supportgroupname "Development" -newsupportgroupcompany "Calbro Services" -newsupportgrouporganisation "IT Service Management" -newsupportgroupname "Development" -loglevel info
sample.description: Performs usual actions (mentioned in the first example) and additionally update changes in incidents and incident templates replacing old group with the new one and authoring areas is updated as well. All secondary authoring groups are evaluated for this type of change.

sample.code: areasy -runtime -action supportgroupmigration -allgroupdetails -supportgroupcompany "Calbro Services" -supportgrouporganisation "IT Support" -supportgroupname "Service Desk" -newsupportgroupcompany "Calbro Services" -newsupportgrouporganisation "IT Support" -newsupportgroupname "Help Desk" -loglevel info -assetrelationships on
sample.description: Makes old group offline creates a new support group and transfer from old group to the new one all details. Additionally update all asset relationships where a support group is related, replacing old group with the new one.

sample.code: areasy -runtime -arserver localhost -arport 2000 -aruser Demo -arpassword "" -action supportgroupmigration -allgroupdetails -supportgroupcompany "Calbro Services" -supportgrouporganisation "IT Support" -supportgroupname "Service Desk" -newsupportgroupcompany "Calbro Services" -newsupportgrouporganisation "IT Support" -newsupportgroupname "Help Desk" -loglevel info -assetrelationships on
sample.description: The same target command but with an explicit connection to AR System server. The action will be executed in runtime mode (because of -runtime option specified in the command line)
